body: @Ajedi32 hmmm, I don't follow. If you want to allow unconfirmed access for users all the time why do you need to use `confirmable` module at all? :)
@nashby Because I still want to enable or disable access to certain features of the website based on whether the user has a confirmed email address or not.

issue.title: allow_unconfirmed_access_for set to nil means unconfirmed access for unlimited time

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

body:
Please mention the use of `nil` for `allow_unconfirmed_access_for` in docs. 

I read docs, then googled, then found a StackOverflow answer mentioning the use of value nil.
I'm with @r-a-o. I've just spend a lot more time than i want to admit to figure out my problem was solved by `config.allow_unconfirmed_access_for = nil`

issue.title: Devise recoverable & confirmable

repository.name: qkspace
repository.description: A minimalistic knowledge base (KB) for small teams

issue.body:
Closes #54 

Заодно пофиксил заголовки контроллера registrations в yml

Соответственно на прод надо установить и настроить postfix @installero

issue.title: chore(docs): allow_unconfirmed_access_for = nil (#2275)

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body: Just documenting the `nil` value for `allow_unconfirmed_access_for` as displayed here: https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/2275
